result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J. Scharloo

records.addlTxt:
2:51 PM Defendant Michael J. Scharloo appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court, via zoom for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John Zich in court, via zoom for Michael J. Scharloo. Atty Zich has copy of information, waives reading, reserve rights  and enters Not Guilty plea.  Court receives Not Guilty plea. Court finds good cause for def. to appear via telephone.  No objection for def. appearance via telephone.  Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

8:50 AM in Room 203. Defendant Michael J. Scharloo appeared by video, in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John Zich in court for Michael J. Scharloo. All appearances are by Zoom. Def. can hear. Chief Dan Duley, duly sworn on oath, testifies. Testimony closed. Court finds probable cause, binds over for filing of Information. Arraignment to be set.
Arraignment scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:37 PM Defendant Michael J. Scharloo appeared by phone from Dodge Correctional Ins..  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Attorney John Zich in court for Michael J. Scharloo. Atty Zich has copy of complaint, waives reading and has not spoke to def. RE time limits. CC questions def. RE: time limits for p.h.  Def. request timely p.h.  Atty Zich questions if reserve judge on call.  State recites court calendar.  State ask to continue AIA for next hearing. Atty Zich gives statement. CC gives options. State request brief recess. Def. agrees to appear via zoom.  CC will allow def. to appear via zoom for P.H. Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Amended
No contact with any minors. 
No possession of device that access internet.

01:03 PM Defendant Michael J. Scharloo in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael J. Scharloo appeared by video means. All parties via zoom. Court reviews history of case.  Form was sent to def. for waiver of atty rights.  Jailor is bringing over form. State moves to modify bond as extended supervision has been revoked, $50,000 signature bond with same conditions.  Def. makes statement and would like to stay in county jail.  Court will grant State request & amend to $50,000 Signature bond with same conditions. Waiver of right to atty filed.  Def. wants to represent himself. Court goes over waiver of right to atty form with def. Court goes over charges and penalties with def. Def. still wants to represent himself. Court continues with waiver.  Def. would like to stop and look into counsel. Court will suspend waiver. Def. would like waiver form be given back to him. Court orders COC to give back to def. and not file Waiver of Right to Atty.  DA ask that def. contact P.D., Court so orders.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

03:18 PM Defendant Michael J. Scharloo in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael J. Scharloo appeared by video means, via zoom.  Def. would like to represent himself.  Court orders COC to send form down to def. for waiver of attorney rights. Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

No contact with any minors. 
No device that access internet.

01:44 PM Defendant Michael J. Scharloo in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael J. Scharloo appeared by video means.  All parties via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. would like P.D. State has been advise def. extended supervision is getting revoked.  State gives bail/bond recommendation.  Def. heard on bond. Court orders  $25,000 cash bond with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
